result.execSummary:
The defendant James M Burke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, James M Burke was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James M Burke is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • James M Burke was found guilty of Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant James M Burke in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Attorney Willett appears telephonically.  Defendant James M Burke in custody.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing Hearing on count 4.
Argument by State.
Argument by Attorney Willett.

Court relates and orders:
90 days jail with good time.  Credit for 68 days.  Time served sentence.
Court costs - 60 days to pay.
DNA sample and surcharge to be paid in 60 days.

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must submit DNA sample immediately. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Rights forms provided to defendant.  

Minute Sheet faxed to jail.

Clerked by AP. 
Attorney Stephen Donald Willett in court (telephonically).  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared (telephonically) for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 15CF571 AND 15CM545

15CF571 - Jury trial is currently set for 3/08/17.  Atty. Willett moves for continuance;  Court grants motion.  Jury trial reset to 04/27/17 and 04/28/17.

15CM545 - Sentence hearing has already been set for 3/03/17 at 2:45 PM  (Atty. Willett may appear telephonically; defendant must appear in person).
to Continue Sentencing Hearing
Jury meals $92.52
Witness fees and mileage $105.20
Juror mileage and fees $1,814.98
Sentencing hearing on March 3, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on February 1, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Juror question
Count 4 - Guilty
Count 3 - Not Guilty
Count 2 - Not Guilty
Count 1 - Not Guilty
for Return/Destruction of Exhibits.

1.  Cell phone of victim, 2. Photocopy of information on victim cell phone, 3. Photocopy of information on victim cell phone, 4. Photocopy of text messages, 5. Photocopy of text message, 6. Photocopy of marriage, 7. Photocopy of James and Tiffany, 8. Photocopy of 2 children, and 9. Photocopy of wedding.
and Peremptory challenges

8:05 AM
Defendant James M Burke in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant James M Burke in custody.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
States motion in limine discussed. No objection by the state;  No objection by defense.  Witness list discussed;  No objection by the state;  1 objection by defense re: Detective Olson; State gives argument;  Defense objection stands.  Court sustains Mr Willetts objection.  Preliminary instructions discussed.  No objections; Voir dire questions discussed.  Detective Mary Dexter will be the courtroom Officer.  Attorney Willett objects to Mary Dexter being court officer and testifying.  Court finds under statute, the court officer may testify.  
Sharon M., Clerk
8:48 18 jurors seated.  8:49 All jurors sworn.  Court voir dire.  8:52 Court recesses.  8:53 Court resumes.  9:08 State voir dire.  9:16 Defense voir dire.  9:30 Peremptory strikes made and Court reads preliminary jury instructions.  9:40 Jury panel sworn.  9:41 Jury excused.  No objection by State or Defense regarding jury panel.  9:42 Court recesses.
10:05   Court resumes.  Jurors enter and State gives opening statement.   10:16  Detective Mary Dexter called, sworn and direct by State;
PL EX #1 cell phone of victim; offered and received
PL EX #2  photo copy of messaging information off of victims cell phone;  offered and received
PL EX #3  photo copy of contact information off of victims cell phone;offered and received
PL EX #4  photo copy packet of series of text messages; Defense objects; Jurors exit. Argument by State; Argument by Defense; Court over rules objection;offered and received;
 10:33  Jurors return;  Direct continues; 10:35 cross by Attorney Willett;10:40  Jurors  Exit. Court strikes the testimony re: extraction; 10:45 Jurors return and cross continues.  10:51 Re-direct by the State; 10:52 Re-cross by Defense; 10:54  Tiffany B (P) called, sworn and direct by State;   Witness identified the defendant;  
PL EX #5 photo copy of message; offered and received.
PL EX #6 photo copy of marriage 8/12/2015; offered and received
PL EX #7 photo copy of defendant and Tiffany 7/4/2015; offered and received
PL EX #8 packet of photo copy of 2 children; offered and received
PL EX #9 photo copy of wedding 8/12/2015; offered and received
State moves to strike;  Defense moves for a mistrial. Argument by State;  Court takes 10 minute break.  11:23  jurors exit.   11:55  Court resumes.   Defenses motion for a mistrial discussed re: was it prejudicial or not.  Court denies defenses motion for a mistrial.   12:21 Court  breaks for lunch.  12:57  Court resumes.  Tiffany B (P)  retakes the stand  1:02  Jurors return;  Direct continues.   1:21  Cross by Attorney Willett.  1:49  Re-direct by state;  1:52  Re-cross by Attorney Willett. 1:54  Mary G called, sworn and direct by state.  2:02  Cross by Attorney Willett.  2:08  Re-direct by state.  2:09  Re-cross by Attorney Willett;  State rests.  2:12  jurors exit.  5 minute recess;  2:23  court resumes.  Defendant will not testify.  Defendant sworn;  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Jury instructions discussed. 300 & 315 changed.  No other objections;  Verdict forms discussed.  No objections;  
5 minute recess.  Motion for mistrial given again by Attorney Willett.  Court again denies the motion for a mistrial.   
2:49  Jury returns;  Defense waives his opening request and rests. Testimony closed.   Jury instructions given to the jury.  3:05 Closing argument given by the State; 3:21 Closing argument given by Defense; 3:40 Rebuttal given by the state.  3:46    Final jury instructions given.  3:51   Bailiff sworn.  Jurors Exit to deliberate. No objection  by the State or by the Defense for the reading of the instructions.
S. Millermon, Clerk
5:07 Court in session outside of presence of jury.  Jury requests an exhibit 4.  No objection by State.  Attorney Willett objects as he previously objected to submission of exhibit.  Court grants and send exhibit 4 back to jury.
5:09 Court recesses.
5:58 Jury returns with verdict.
Count 1 - not guilty
Count 2 - not guilty
Count 3 - not guilty
Count 4 - guilty
6:02 Jury excused.

State moves to adjudication on count 4.  Attorney Willett moves to dismiss counts 1 - 3.
Court dismisses counts 1 - 3.  Court finds guilty of count 4.

TSC to be set for scheduling a Sentencing Hearing.

6:05 Court adjourns and continues bond on this case.

Defendant James M Burke in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant James M Burke in custody.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM545 & 15CF571. 
15CM545 - Motion to dismiss count 4 filed by Defense. Argument by Defense. Argument by State. Court denies the motion to dismiss. Set for #1 JT 01/25/17 at 8:00 AM.

Defendant James M Burke in court, in custody with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF435, 15CF440, 15CF541, 15CF571 & 15CM545
In 15CM545, 15CF541 and 15CF571 - Defense requests a bond modification from a $5000.00 cash bond to a $25000.00 signature bond. State objects to bond modification request. Court denies the request to modify bond. 

15CF541 - Motion to continue the trial. Defense is not prepared to try the case as scheduled. Defense indicates an in camera review may be necessary and request for independent psychological evaluation of alleged victim and release of medical records. Defendant withdraws/waives any previously noted Demand for Speedy Trial. Court accepts withdrawal/waiver for speedy trial. Court grants request Defense's to adjourn the trial date. 

15CF435 - Motion to dismiss for insufficient information filed by Defense. State relates. Court relates and denies the motion at this time. 

Court orders all cases to track to 12/2/16 at 2:30 PM before Judge Boyle if not already scheduled. 

JAIL FAXED.
Motion hearing on December 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant James M Burke in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant James M Burke in custody.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James M Burke in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Defendant James M Burke in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF541, 15CF571, 15CF435, 15CF440 AND 15CM545. 

15CF435 and 15CF440: Surety requests bond be returned. State makes objection. The Court denies request to return bond to surety.

15CF541: Detective Mary Dexter with the Barron County Sheriff's Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. 12:00: Defendant questions witness. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. 

15CF571: 12:04 - Detective Mary Dexter with the Barron County Sheriff's Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. 12:08: Defendant questions witness. State makes argument. Defendant makes argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial.

15CF571 & 15CF541: Arraignment set for January 25, 2016 at 2:00 p.m. Other cases to track along.

Defense makes speedy trial demands in all 4 cases. Court takes note of requests.

BOND COVERS 15CF541, 15CF571 AND 15CM545.
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

$5,000.00 cash bond is in addition to $5,000.00 cash bond posted in 15CF435 and 15CF440.
Must have no contact with F.C.L., dob:  02/22/2002.
Must have no contact with S.D.L., dob:  07/03/1974.
Must have no contact with T.R.B., dob:  11/24/1990.
Must have no contact with A.M.M., dob:  01/08/2011.
Must have no contact with D.B.B., dob:  09/08/2000.
Must have no unsupervised contact with any minors.
Must not possess any firearms.

Defendant James M Burke in court with attorney Aaron Olson for today.  Defendant James M Burke in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF541, 15CF571 and 15CM545 called.  Quash warrant in 15CF541.  Attorney Olson advises appointed reserve counsel on 15CF440 and 15CF435 and is making a special appearance for today and requests to reserve any jurisdictional matters.  Court questions defendant.  Reading of Complaints waived.  Court enters not guilty pleas on all misdemeanor charges on behalf of the defendant.  State's bond argument.  Attorney Olson's bond argument.  Court sets bond.  Preliminary hearing set for both CF files.  15CF435 and 15CF440 are also to be set for that time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 11:30 am.
